snippet: Several factors contributed to ease the shortage, but Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said the city’s odd-even rationing rules would continue.
abstract: Fuel shortage in New York region that had threatened to disrupt travel during Thanksgiving week has eased, but industry experts warn that a full recovery of gasoline supplies is still weeks away, largely because of continuing repairs to the cluster of terminals around Linden, NJ, where barges and trucks load fuel to deliver throughout the region.

byline.original: By WINNIE HU and CLIFFORD KRAUSS

lead_paragraph: Several factors contributed to ease the shortage, but Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said the city’s odd-even rationing rules would continue.

headline.seo: Gas Shortage Eases With Rations, Special Deliveries and Refinery’s Return
headline.main: Gas Crisis Abates, With Rations, Special Deliveries and Refinery’s Return
headline.print_headline: Gas Crisis Abates, With Rations, Special Deliveries and Refinery’s Return
